page.title: 20Kensworth in 1985
page.content: During the Spring 4 performances of a pantomime with over 50 in the cast were held in the village hall.A Carnival,the theme something old, something new, on 8 June started with a grand parade lead by a pipe band. A host of stalls & entertainments were on the rec,the emphasis on raising funds for all the village organisations & entertaining the children.The sun shone for once in a very wet summer,everyone enjoyed themselves.At Nash Farm 3 dances were held,inMay A Country & Western Night, in June A Jazz Band Ball,& in July a Caribbean Evening.Â£2200 was raised mainly for Church Restoration but also for the Heart Foundation.Each event was a sell out the tickets Â£3.75 to include food,a bar,& non stop dancing to live bands.These events helped create a better village atmosphere.
